snippet: The federal appeals court reinstated the 2008 conspiracy conviction of a detainee at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, but the long-awaited decision was more confusing than clarifying.
abstract: United States Appeals Court reinstates 2008 conspiracy conviction of Guantanamo Bay prisoner Ali al-Bahlul without establishing any clear principle applicable to other detainees.
lead_paragraph: The federal appeals court reinstated the 2008 conspiracy conviction of a detainee at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, but the long-awaited decision was more confusing than clarifying.

headline.main: A Federal Appeals Court Sidesteps How to Prosecute Detainees
headline.print_headline: Court Sidesteps How to Prosecute Detainees

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
